subject: Education
title: Reggio Emilia: The Child as Protagonist
description: Learn Reggio Emilia: The Child as Protagonist in one minute.

hook.text: In Reggio Emilia schools, there is no set curriculum. Children's questions become the curriculum.

buildup.text: After WWII, parents in Reggio Emilia, Italy built a new kind of school from the rubble.

discovery.text: The approach sees children as capable, curious researchers who learn through projects and documentation.

twist.text: Teachers are co-learners, not instructorsâ€”they provoke questions rather than deliver answers.

climax.text: Newsweek called Reggio Emilia schools the best in the world for young children.

punchline.text: The best early education follows the child's curiosity, not the teacher's plan.

quiz.question: What is the teacher's role in the Reggio Emilia approach?
options: A co-learner who provokes questions and documents children's inquiry
A strict instructor who delivers a fixed curriculum
An observer who provides no interaction
